conclusion: To find the propagation time of light in the prism, we need to follow these steps.
The light enters the prism at an incident angle i = 45° and hits the midpoint O of side AB.
Use Snell's Law: n1 sin(i) = n2 sin(r) to solve for the angle of refraction r.
The light travels through the prism and exits perpendicular to side AC.
The light exits perpendicular to AC, so the angle of incidence at AC is 30°.
Apply Snell's Law at AC: n2 sin(30°) = 1 sin(90°), resulting in n2 = 2.
Use the geometry of the isosceles triangle to find the distance traveled by light inside the prism.
The light travels along the height of the triangle from O to AC.
Speed of light in the prism is v = c/n2 = c/2.
Use the triangle properties to find d = L sin(30°) = L/2.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = L/c.
